column4: I'm just trying to load from a LiveCD but when it gets to starting gdm all I get are a bunch of tightly packed beige stripes across the screen. It's on both the 32 and 64 bit Ubuntu LiveCDs. The burns should be good, I used them before yesterday on the same machine
do you know what brand of graphics chip you have?
Actually i'm wrong, it's an ATI Radeon Xpress 1150, just googled it

when booting ESC-enter_lang-F6-Esc. Try adding "xforcevesa" to the grub line after quiet splash. This is a workaround, and you will need to find a real fix (maybe installing proprietary drivers) if you choose to install.
the very first graphics screen with the two icons at the bottom.
Didn't work, got the stripes again
you might try acpi=off seperatly or in addition
that was already on the line
you are a gentlemen and a scholar
that's right. Gentlemen, your kindness is that of many
yep, the acpi=none with xforcevesa worked
